cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of testing properties of probability distributions, which is a common topic in information theory (cs.IT), as well as in machine learning and statistics. The focus on uniformity testing suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of computational geometry (cs.CG), where uniformity testing is a well-studied problem. The use of information-theoretic lower bounds and sample complexity analysis suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfields of learning theory (cs.LG) and computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the use of discrete probability distributions and total variation distance suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of stochastic processes (cs.SI).
